metadata.Title: CVE-2021-41165 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
CKEditor4 is an open source WYSIWYG HTML editor. In affected version a vulnerability has been discovered in the core HTML processing module and may affect all plugins used by CKEditor 4. The vulnerability allowed to inject malformed comments HTML bypassing content sanitization, which could result in executing JavaScript code. It affects all users using the CKEditor 4 at version < 4.17.0. The problem has been recognized and patched. The fix will be available in version 4.17.0.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-41165` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ckeditor - 4.19.1+dfsg-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> embedded copies of ckeditor are in ldap-account-manager, rt4, and rt5 litios> No specific patch was found

criterions.comment: ckeditor package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.19.1+dfsg-1').
ckeditor3 package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
ldap-account-manager package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
request-tracker4 package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
